label: Suspect · 1939 – 1963
notes: Described as physically identical to the hitchhiker picked up by Yates on Nov 20, 1963. Former U.S. Marine, defector to the Soviet Union, and primary suspect in the assassination.

label: Main Witness · 1928 – 1975
notes: Refrigeration mechanic who reported picking up a hitchhiker on Nov 20, 1963 matching Oswald's description. Reported the incident to the FBI before the assassination. Later committed to a psychiatric facility.

label: Key Witness · 1937 – Present
notes: Cuban exile who testified that Lee Harvey Oswald, accompanied by two Latin men, visited her Dallas apartment in late September 1963 to discuss anti-Castro activities. Her testimony raised significant questions about Oswald's timeline.

label: Target · 1909 – 1993
notes: Resigned U.S. Army Major General and right-wing political figure. Target of an assassination attempt at his home in Dallas on April 10, 1963, which was later attributed to Lee Harvey Oswald by the Warren Commission.

label: Key Witness · 1932 – Present
notes: Irving, TX resident who hosted Marina Oswald and her children. She helped Lee Harvey Oswald secure employment at the Texas School Book Depository in October 1963 and stored his rifle in her garage.

label: Spouse · Yates Family
notes: Wife of Ralph Leon Yates. Accompanied him to the Dallas FBI office on January 15, 1964, during his final appearance before hospitalization.

label: Family · Yates Uncle
notes: Uncle of Ralph Leon Yates. Resided at 13770 Sprucewood, Dallas TX. Accompanied Yates to the Dallas FBI office on November 27, 1963 for his formal interview.

label: Witness · TBSC Employee
notes: Co-worker of Ralph Yates at Texas Butchers Supply Company for 9.5 years. Route 4, Box 376, Dallas TX, phone Diamond 8-1051. Corroborated that Yates told him about the hitchhiker BEFORE the assassination. Described Yates as 'a big talker who always talks about a lot of foolishness.'

label: Employer · TBSC Partner
notes: Partner at Texas Butchers Supply Company. Verified service call records (Shop Bill No. 8760, Invoice No. 36919) confirming Yates was dispatched to Irving on November 21, 1963. Recalled giving Yates the order around 10:30 AM.

label: Employer · TBSC Partner
notes: Partner at Texas Butchers Supply Company. Recalled that Yates called in from Irving, Texas sometime after 11:30 AM on November 21, 1963.

label: FBI Special Agent · Dallas Office
notes: FBI Special Agent who conducted multiple interviews with Ralph Yates. Took signed statement December 10, 1963. Received distressed phone call from Yates on January 8, 1964. Present during Yates' final appearance January 15, 1964.

label: FBI Special Agent · Dallas Office
notes: FBI Special Agent who conducted initial interview with Ralph Yates on November 27, 1963. Also interviewed Dempsey Jones on the same date.

label: FBI Special Agent · Dallas Office
notes: FBI Special Agent who witnessed Ralph Yates' signed statement on December 10, 1963 in Dallas, Texas.

label: FBI Special Agent · Dallas Office
notes: FBI Special Agent who conducted re-interview of Ralph Yates on January 3, 1964, regarding discrepancies in his service call timeline. Also interviewed Thomas Ayres and Donald Mask at Charlie's Ranch Meat Market.

label: Nightclub Owner · 1911 – 1967
notes: Owner of the Carousel Club nightclub in Dallas. Born Jacob Leon Rubenstein. The hitchhiker in Yates' account asked if Yates knew 'Jack Rubenstein, more commonly known as Jack Ruby' who ran the Carousel Club. Ruby later shot and killed Lee Harvey Oswald on November 24, 1963.

label: Politician · 1900 – 1965
notes: U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations. Referenced by Yates in his conversation with the hitchhiker—Yates mentioned the hostile reception Stevenson received in Dallas (October 24, 1963) as a reason the President should not visit.

label: Witness · Charlie's Meat Market
notes: Employee at Charlie's Ranch Meat Market, 249 Wynnewood Village, Dallas TX. On duty November 20-21, 1963. Could not recall giving a check to a TBSC employee. Reviewed check stubs with negative results.

label: Witness · Charlie's Meat Market
notes: Employee at Charlie's Ranch Meat Market, 249 Wynnewood Village, Dallas TX. On duty November 21, 1963. Could not recall giving a check to a TBSC employee.

label: Witness · Auto Salesman
notes: Auto salesman who claimed that at about 3 PM on November 9, 1963, he accompanied an individual who identified himself as 'Lee Oswald' on a new car demonstration ride. Subject reportedly drove 75-85 mph and indicated he would pay cash for a new car within 2-3 weeks. Bogard wrote name on business card which he destroyed after subject's death.

label: Family · Yates Mother
notes: Mother of Ralph Leon Yates. Resided on Elizabeth Street, Dallas TX. Yates mentioned family history of mental illness during his distressed state.

label: Family · Yates Daughter
notes: Eldest daughter of Ralph Leon Yates. Age 6 in 1963. Resided at 13564 Brookgreen, Dallas TX.

label: Family · Yates Daughter
notes: Second daughter of Ralph Leon Yates. Age 5 in 1963. Resided at 13564 Brookgreen, Dallas TX.

label: Family · Yates Daughter
notes: Third daughter of Ralph Leon Yates. Age 3 in 1963. Resided at 13564 Brookgreen, Dallas TX.

label: Family · Yates Son
notes: First son of Ralph Leon Yates. Age 2 in 1963. Resided at 13564 Brookgreen, Dallas TX.

label: Family · Yates Son
notes: Second son of Ralph Leon Yates. Age 1 in 1963. Resided at 13564 Brookgreen, Dallas TX.

label: General Counsel · Warren Commission
notes: General Counsel for the Warren Commission who directed the investigation's legal and investigative strategy.

label: Chief Justice · Commission Chair
notes: Chief Justice of the United States and Chairman of the President's Commission on the Assassination of President Kennedy.

label: Assistant Counsel · Warren Commission
notes: Assistant Counsel for the Warren Commission, best known for developing the 'Single Bullet Theory'.
